channel.title: Can anyone recommend a good IDE?
channel.description:
Well, I've decided to start programming Java again, and since I don't like using Notepad, I would like an IDE.
I don't give a shit about GUI editors and all that. I like Code Completion, Syntax Hilighting and built in JavaDocs.
Can anyone suggest one with these features?

item.title: Can anyone recommend a good IDE?
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

netbeans I would suggest IDEA but its become rather bloated.

Read full topic
item.source: Can anyone recommend a good IDE?

item.title: Can anyone recommend a good IDE?

item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I used to write only in notepad, but now I use eclipse. I like it a lot.

Read full topic

item.title: Can anyone recommend a good IDE?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

I prefer Netbeans as it is the only one Ive used, but it’s really up to you, just try out Eclipse and Netbeans to see which you would prefer more.

Read full topic
item.source: Can anyone recommend a good IDE?

item.title: Can anyone recommend a good IDE?
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]The lag would be based off your computer specs, and all the shit you have installed.

Telling that it lags, I can only guess you have low memory, or a bunch of shit, because I run Eclipse perfectly on low RAM.[/quote]

Windows Vista, everything is slow. It’s also a laptop (with pretty crappy specs), so yeah.

Read full topic
item.source: Can anyone recommend a good IDE?

item.title: Can anyone recommend a good IDE?
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

I Vain I:

Eclipse, no doubt.

Eclipse laggs me a lot, I use the basic neatbeans.

So I’d obviously recommend netbeans.

Read full topic
